intro: Strumaria angustifolia, commonly known as the narrowleaf strumaria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and clusters of small, white or pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often found in coastal areas and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens. Strumaria angustifolia is also known for its ability to produce a fragrant scent, particularly in the evening.
